review: I purchased the FireTV even though I could access much of the same content through my Sony HDTV. Frequently I had experienced problems with outages and choppy streaming when connecting through the Sony server. These problems have nearly been eliminated with the FireTV. I did experience one minor problem with set up. All of my existing home theater components (Blu-Ray, DVR, etc.) are switched through my Onkyo TX-NR808 receiver. When I connected the FireTV to an open HDMI input, I was not able to bring up the home screen on the Sony TV. The Onkyo receivers are known to have HDMI handshaking problems with some components, so I connected the Fire TV to an open HDMI input on the TV. The setup program came right up and everything was working in just a couple of minutes. I still have sound through the receiver and 7.1 speaker system via the audio return channel through the HDMI connection between the TV and receiver. So far I have only streamed content from Amazon and the Berlin Philharmonic, but have been very happy with the responsiveness of the FireTV compared to navigating through the software on the Sony TV.
author: Grigori
